response.name: Any two factors - renamed again
response.description: Require two factors to access.

response.name: Classic Migrated renamed
response.description: Policy created during OIE upgrade and applied to all applications that were protected by the default app-sign on policy in Classic.

response.name: Password only
response.description: Require only a password. Suggested for low risk or consumer-facing applications.

response.name: One factor access
response.description: Allow access with any one factor. Suggested for low risk or consumer-facing applications.

response.name: Seamless access based on network context
response.description: Require 2FA if the user is off network. Configure your network zones to include them here.

response.name: Seamless access based on risk context
response.description: Allow seamless log in with Okta FastPass for low risk authentication scenarios with enhanced security for medium and high risk.

profile.description: Okta manages this group, which contains all administrators in your organization.

response.name: user
response.title: User
response.description: Okta user profile template with default permission settings

response.name: superuser
response.title: Super User
response.description: super duper

response.name: App settings permissions for custom admin roles
response.description: Super admins can assign permissions for custom admin roles to manage all app settings, or only general app settings.

response.name: Enable custom admin roles for device permissions
response.description: Create custom admin roles with granular permissions for managing devices

response.name: Okta Workflows actions in Access Requests
response.description: Run a delegated flow in Okta Workflows directly from a Request Type.

response.name: Workday writeback enhancement
response.description: Use independent Workday API calls to update work and home contacts and avoid unnecessary change requests to Workday. This feature requires Work Contact Change and Home Contact Change business process permissions in Workday.

response.name: Workflow Session IP Binding
response.description: Enforces the check in Workflows that verifies if the requesting IP address matches the IP address used to initiate the session

response.name: Use the default user profile for Org2Org
response.description: Enable using the default user profile only for Org2Org

response.name: Enhanced Dynamic Network Zones
response.description: Use enhanced dynamic network zones to allow or block specific IP service categories (proxies, VPNs, and more), locations, and Autonomous System Numbers (ASNs) in a zone.

response.name: Includes factor enrollment nickname on End-User Settings page
response.description: End-users can nickname their phone, WebAuthn, and Okta Verify factors. If they have enrolled multiple instances of a factor, giving nicknames helps them identify the factors quickly. For example, “My personal cellphone” or “My office MacBook TouchID”.

response.name: Realms
response.description: Realms allows you to unlock greater flexibility in managing and delegating management of your distinct user populations within a single org. Note: It may take a few minutes for realms to appear in your org when you enable this feature.

response.name: Protected Actions
response.description: Protected actions offer an additional layer of security for admin actions in Okta. Admins will be prompted to authenticate when they perform a critical action.

response.name: FIPS compliance
response.description: This feature allows you to configure FIPS compliance on iOS or Android devices that enroll in Okta Verify.

response.name: Access request conditions and resource catalog
response.description: Streamline configuration of access requests for apps, entitlements, and groups from the app's profile page in the Okta Admin Console. Enable request submission directly integrated with the Okta End User Dashboard.

response.name: Require phishing-resistant authenticator to enroll additional authenticators
response.description: Users must verify their identity using a phishing-resistant authenticator before enrolling in additional authenticators.

response.name: Google Workspace express setup
response.description: Enables a seamless and efficient integration experience by simplifying SSO setup for the GSuite application

response.name: Manage SAML Application session lifetimes with Okta
response.description: Enhance security of SAML applications by managing a user's session lifetime using Okta.

response.name: Dynamic OS version compliance
response.description: Configure device assurance policies to stay up-to-date with the latest major OS releases and patch updates without manually updating policy.

response.name: Include the Sign in with FastPass button when a Smart Card Identity Provider is configured
response.description: Displays both Sign in with FastPass and Sign in with PIV/CAC buttons in the Sign in Widget when a Smart Card Identity Provider is configured.

response.name: Event Hook Filtering
response.description: Allows the addition of filters to Event Hooks to only fire on specific events

response.name: Org2Org Incremental Imports
response.description: Enabling this flag, enables incremental imports for Okta Org2Org

response.name: Includes factor enrollment nickname in SIW
response.description: End-users can nickname their phone, WebAuthn, and Okta Verify factors. If they have enrolled multiple instances of a factor, giving nicknames helps them identify the factors quickly. For example, “My personal cellphone” or “My office MacBook TouchID”.

response.name: Access Certifications - Customizable Reviewer Context
response.description: Use this feature to enable the ability to customize the fields available for reviewers to their review table, as well as allow them to filter and sort the table in new ways to ensure they have the information they need to make their decisions.

response.name: Automatically update Okta LDAP agents
response.description: Automatically update Okta LDAP agents to ensure your org has the latest agent features and functionality. You no longer need to manually uninstall and then reinstall outdated agents, you can schedule agent auto-updates to occur outside of business hours.

response.name: Enforce MFA For Admin Console
response.description: This feature requires multi-factor authentication to access the Okta admin console. It automatically updates any single-factor rules that protect the Okta admin console to multi-factor. Note - once rules are automatically updated, they are not reverted when this feature is disabled.

response.name: End User Settings version 2.0
response.description: Customers are able to update their Account Settings easily with or without logging into the End User Dashboard. End User Settings will be available as its own application that is accessible from End User Dashboard with accessibility and UX improvements.

response.name: Custom languages for Okta Email Templates
response.description: Admins can customize Okta-generated emails in any language

response.name: OFFICE365 GCC High
response.description: Support integration with Office365 GCC High Environment.

response.name: Enable optional email enrollment for Okta Identity Engine
response.description: Supports optional email authenticator enrollment when Okta Identity Engine is enabled.

response.name: Govern Okta Admin Roles
response.description: Adopt a zero standing privilege model for your org by allowing users to request time-bound access to Okta admin roles and periodically reviewing their admin access.

response.name: IDP MyAccount API 2FA If Possible
response.description: The MyAccount API feature provides admins and app developers the ability to support the constraint urn:okta:loa:2fa:any:ifpossible in the acr_values parameter.

response.name: Enable Managed Apple ID federation and provisioning
response.description: This feature enables automatic provisioning of Managed Apple IDs which also provides federated authentication and allows for streamlined access into Apple resources. Okta also enhances the security story by sharing CAEP events through our Shared Signals Framework (SSF) pipeline which allows Apple to take real-time actions on known identity threats.

response.name: Block passkeys for FIDO2 (WebAuthn) Authenticators
response.description: Syncable Passkeys are FIDO credentials that are backed up and synchronized across devices. NOTE: This block is best effort and is dependent on browser and OS configuration.

response.name: Front-channel Single Logout
response.description: SAML and OIDC single logout requests will trigger subsequent logout requests to all other participating apps with active sessions

response.name: Okta Personal for Workforce
response.description: Okta Personal is a free consumer password manager. Okta Personal for Workforce integrates Okta Personal with Okta workforce for a seamless but separate experience between work and personal accounts. Manage preferences in Customizations > Okta Personal.

response.name: Save password during app sign up
response.description: This feature allows users using the Okta plugin to save usernames and passwords for apps when users sign up for a new account for that app.

response.name: Network Restrictions for SSWS Token
response.description: Configure network zone for each token, controlling which IP addresses or ranges the SSWS API token can be used from to call Okta APIs

response.name: Admin Console Japanese translations
response.description: This feature will show the admin console in Japanese if the admin user's display language preference is set to Japanese.

response.name: Trusted App Filters for Okta FastPass
response.description: You can now create Trusted App filters for FastPass using Okta Expression Language. Trusted App filters allow orgs to manage which applications can invoke Okta FastPass in Windows, and in Google Chrome and Firefox browsers for macOS.

response.name: Migration Support for Workspace ONE Device Trust for Android and iOS
response.description: This feature provides the capability for migrating existing Workspace ONE Device Trust for mobile configurations into Okta Identity Engine (OIE). This feature must be enabled before running through the self-service upgrade to Okta Identity Engine (OIE).

response.name: Multiple Identifiers
response.description: In the profile enrollment policy, admins can configure user identifiers, or user profile attributes, that can be used to identify an end user. Identifiers can be used across sign-in, unlock, and recovery flows in Okta.

response.name: Enforce number challenge for Desktop MFA
response.description: Enabling this feature makes all push notifications for Desktop MFA a number challenge, regardless of the authentication policy. Desktop MFA is a paid feature, reach out to your account team if you do not yet own this feature.

response.name: Block all requests from anonymizers
response.description: Block requests from anonymizing proxies

response.name: Cron based User Import scheduling
response.description: Enable user import scheduling with cron

response.name: Enable Custom Admin Roles for Identity Providers
response.description: Create custom admin roles with granular permissions for managing Identity Providers

response.name: IDP MyAccount Password API
response.description: The MyAccount Password API feature provides admins and app developers access to a user-scoped API endpoint that can create/update/remove password.

response.name: Skip the verify screen and redirect to the IdP authenticator
response.description: This feature allows users to skip the verify step in the Sign-in Widget. They are instead redirected to the IdP authenticator for verification.

response.name: Okta Browser Plugin credential management enhancements
response.description: Users can now click the Okta Browser Plugin's new aura component to fill in the username and password fields when signing in to applications. This provides an alternate method to users for signing in to their apps.

response.name: Same-Device Enrollment for Okta FastPass
response.description: End users will be prompted to enroll into the same device if the org is using Okta FastPass. The enrollment process is more seamless by prompting the user to install and set up Okta Verify with fewer steps.

response.name: Windows Autopilot Enrollment Policy
response.description: IT admins will have the capability to create contextual access policies for Windows Autopilot Enrollment requests. The feature is only supported on Okta Identity Engine (OIE).

notify.subject: Notification about your Okta account
notify.message:
Notification for $!{StringTool.escapeHtml($!{user.profile.firstName})} $!{StringTool.escapeHtml($!{user.profile.department})}
Hi $!{StringTool.escapeHtml($!{user.profile.firstName})},
This is an important notification for you.
Please contact your Okta administrator if you have any questions.
This is an automatically generated message from Okta. Replies are not monitored or answered.

response.title: Atlassian Cloud User
response.description: my user

organizationsWorkTitle.title: Organizations title
organizationsWorkTitle.description: Title (designation) of the user in the organization.

organizationsWorkCostCenter.title: Organizations costCenter
organizationsWorkCostCenter.description: The cost center of the users department.

relationsManagerValue.title: Manager
relationsManagerValue.description: The name of the manager. Must be a valid email in the domain

unassignmentConfig.title: Deactivation options (default is to suspend user)
unassignmentConfig.description: Provide options to not suspend user and remove all licenses on user unassignment

manageLicenses.title: Manage licenses on create and update
manageLicenses.description: Manage license on user assignment and profile push

enum.name: Google Workspace for Education Standard (Extra Student)
Google Workspace for Education Plus (Extra Student)
Google Workspace for Education: Teaching and Learning Upgrade

manageRoles.title: Manage roles on create and update
manageRoles.description: Manage roles on user assignment and profile push

response.name: oidc_client
response.title: OAuth connector to Salto Staging User

name.title: Name
name.description: End-User's full name in displayable form.

nickname.title: Nickname
nickname.description: Casual name of the End-User (may or may not be the same as the given_name)

given_name.title: Given Name
given_name.description: Given name or first name of the End-User.

family_name.title: Family Name
family_name.description: Surname or last name of the End-User.

profile.title: Profile URL
profile.description: URL of the End-User's profile page.

picture.title: Picture URL
picture.description: URL of the End-User's profile picture.

website.title: Website
website.description: URL of the End-User's Web page or blog.

birthdate.title: Birthdate
birthdate.description: End-User's birthday, represented as an ISO 8601:2004 YYYY-MM-DD format.

zoneinfo.title: Time Zone
zoneinfo.description: String representing the End-User's time zone.

locale.title: Locale Name
locale.description: ISO3166‑1 country code in uppercase, separated by a dash (e.g. 'en-US')

phone_number.title: Phone Number
phone_number.description: End-User's preferred telephone number in E.164 format.

region.title: Region
region.description: State, province, prefecture, or region component.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: Zip code or postal code component.

formatted.title: Formatted
formatted.description: Full mailing address, formatted for display.
